Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Grand Style pottery kylix; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; black-figure decoration consisting of wing with added red of possible sphinx; at left, possible head, to right; some elements in reserve and black-figure decoration at bottom; exterior, from top: broad band; two dilute lines; zigzag pattern with red dots in interstices two dilute lines; band of pomegranates; series of dilute and red lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The Laconian influences on this kylix are clear from from a number of features. Laconian black-figured kylixes are a well known vase shape which is not typically found in the Chian repertoire (for instance, see British Museum 1888,0601.523 from Naukratis). The exterior decoration consisting of concentric bands and pomegranate patterns on the sherd are typical of Laconian kylixes. For other Laconian-influenced Chian kylixes, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.133.2 and British Museum 1886,0401.1283.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1901) (phase 2)
